alert.note: Alert for Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 5:43PM CDT until July 04 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL JONES COUNTY... At 543 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported some street flooding in the area following thunderstorms and heavy rain in Laurel. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is up to 0.5 inches per hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laurel, Ellisville and Tuckers Crossing. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
